title: "Free Speech: Brandeis vs. Brandeis"
excerpt: "In the famous 1927 free speech case Whitney v. California, Justice Brandeis wrote, “To justify suppression of free speech there must be reasonable ground to fear that serious evil will result if free speech is practiced … [and] reasonable ground to believe that the danger apprehended is imminent.”"
